Articles.Content:
Not entirely sure where to put this. One of my first missions to Jool I landed back on Kerbin near a large mountain with a fjord next to it. To me, the view look absolutely beautiful. After recovering the vessel, I decided that I wanted to go back and look at it some more. However, I couldn't remember. I didn't have a screenshot because I didn't know how to take screenshots back then, so I had no hints as to its location except that I knew that it was in the southern hemisphere. I tried to find it, but I eventually gave up.

However, earlier today I opened up Hyperedit and started jumping around, and there it was:

![xl5eU39.png](http://i.imgur.com/xl5eU39.png)

It doesn't look as good as my memory made it, but this thing has been bugging me for over a year and it's good to know that I'm not crazy.

Coordinates are approximately latitude -28, longitude 324.
It's close to KSC... fly SE... It's on the other side of the pound... ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)
Install the Scatterer mod and your breath will be taken away again ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
Increase your graphic settings and get low enough that terrain scatter shows up, and it will look prettier?

> 
> Increase your graphic settings and get low enough that terrain scatter shows up, and it will look prettier?

Graphics are all the way up except for antialiasing. But I did forget to turn down the vacuum ambient light on Planetshine before snapping the shot (had it all the way up so that I could look around on the night side), so that could be something I could try.
Have a look for Slartibartfast's signature ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Heh, I saw a lot of similar sights on my circumnavigation (link in my signature)

Kerbin can certainly look beautiful at times... 90% of the time, tho, I'm pretty unimpressed :|
